Legal_Issue: Credibility of applicant, state protection presumption, procedural fairness
Evidence_Type: Testimonial evidence, lack of corroborating evidence
Basis_of_Claim: Fear of persecution due to perceived political opinion and alleged military mistreatment
Key_Factor_in_Determination: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of corroboration, functioning democratic institutions in Mexico
Proceeding_Type: Refugee protection hearing, followed by judicial review
Regulation_Cited: IRPA, sections related to refugee eligibility and credibility
Assessment_Standard: Patent unreasonableness for credibility, reasonableness simpliciter for state protection
Application_Factor: Perceived political opinion, past mistreatment by military
Decision_Review_Issue: Reasonableness of credibility findings and application of state protection presumption
Governing_Rule_or_Provision: IRPA, principles of international protection under UN Convention
Cause_of_Refusal: Lack of credibility, failure to rebut state protection presumption
Evidentiary_Issues: Inconsistent testimony, absence of documentary or witness corroboration
Procedural_Fairness: Applicant waived objection to reverse order questioning
Credibility_Issues: Inconsistencies in testimony, lack of plausibility
Legal_Defense_or_Challenge: Challenge to credibility assessment and procedural fairness
Relevant_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act, Charter of Rights and Freedoms (implied)
Procedural_Issue: Reverse order questioning accepted without objection
